data.text: @DrWatsonJohn_ That sounds awful, John. I hope there aren't any further killings before you can solve it.
As soon as we get any more information, I will update you all. I just hope we don't have another set of bodies over the weekend.

So, current theory is that the killer is actually interested in the skin, but how this brings us any closer to catching them, I don't know.

Sherlock has been in his mind palace for the past two hours. The fact that he hasn't solved it already, shows how odd this one is.
According to Sherlock, this is strange in itself, as a large percentage of people in their twenties have tattoos, and to randomly find six people that didn't have any, seems unlikely.

Each victim has had a single patch of skin removed; all the same size and shape, but taken from different parts of the body.
Immediate theory was that they had a tattoo which the murderer had taken, but family and friends confirmed that none of the victims had tattoos.

I assumed that, as they were holding hands, they were a couple, or at least friends, but they seem to be unknown to each other. In all three cases, family members and friends of one victim did not recognise the other. 
(Sherlock called me an idiot for making assumptions).
